newsrooms having to update stories once or twice an hour are desperate for fresh leads.''- href="http://thefailedestate.blogspot.com/2011/01/spoon-fed.html" target="_blank"> The Failed Estate " The Andy Coulson affair raises the question- who runs Britain? `` That is only one example of the close ties woven between Tony Blair and Gordon Brown , when they were prime ministers, and Cameron now, and the Murdoch camp- the private meetings and dinners, the calls( no hacking there) and the mutual interest. We once used to think of the establishment as being cabinet ministers, archbishops, BBC panjandrums, leaders of industry and royalty. No longer. move on.'' Mr David Cameron said his aide had done an excellent job- and pointed out that Mr Andy Coulson had resigned from the News of the World over the phone hacking claims. He said: I feel he has been punished twice for the same offence.`` I choose to judge him by the work he has done for me, for the Government and the country. Mr Andy Coulson , 43, left the News of the World in January 2007 after its then-Royal editor Clive Goodman and private investigator Glenn Mulcaire were jailed for hacking into mobile voicemails.
